hints.content:
The two longest warmers were  $\maroonD{6 \dfrac12}$ feet and $\purpleD{6}$ feet long.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A line plot labeled volume of juice in fluid ounces shows, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at four, four and one-half, five, five and one-half, six, six and one half, and seven. Faded. are plotted as follows: 1 dot above four and one-half and 2 dots above five. One purple dot is plotted above six and 1 pink dot is plotted above six and one-half.

hints.content:
We can find the total length of the pink warmers by adding.

 $\maroonD{6 \dfrac12}+\purpleD{6} = \maroonD{6} + \purpleD{6} + \maroonD{\dfrac12} = 12\dfrac12$

The shortest warmer was $\blueE{4\dfrac{1}{2}}$ feet long.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A line plot labeled volume of juice in fluid ounces shows, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at four, four and one-half, five, five and one-half, six, six and one half, and seven. Faded are plotted as follows: 2 dots above five; 1 dot above six and 1 dot above six and one-half. One dark dot is plotted at four and one-half.

hints.content:
We can subtract to find the difference between the total length of the pink warmers and the length of the blue warmer.

$12\dfrac12-\blueE{4\dfrac12} = 8$
The combined length of the pink warmers was $8$ feet longer than than the length of the blue warmer.

question.content:
The plot below shows the lengths of $5$ neck warmers that Mary knit for a family of giraffes. 


[[☃ image 1]]

The shortest warmer was blue. The two longest warmers were pink.

**How much longer was the combined length of the pink warmers than the length of the blue warmer?**

[[☃ numeric-input 1]] feet

options.alt: A line plot labeled volume of juice in fluid ounces shows, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at four, four and one-half, five, five and one-half, six, six and one half, and seven. Dots are plotted as follows: 1 dot above four and one-half; 2 dots above five; 1 dot above six and 1 dot above six and one-half.
